website_summaries.verdict: Clean design with no flashy areas, and recent updates to the Ironman model have been well-received.
pros: Stopwatch contains a 10-lap memory area, as well as other simple but useful sports features
Offers water resistance up to 330 ft
cons: Some owners say the watch feels cheaply made
Feature set may be too basic for some people's needs

customer_reviews.title: Clean and simple
customer_reviews.text: Timex recently updated this model. The side buttons are a little larger than the previous model. The design is more streamlined and straightforward. Many other digital watches have too many buttons and useless graphics. This watch works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Toshiba Fan

customer_reviews.title: Love these Ironman watches.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a solid watch that can stand a lot of outdoor activity and some decent beating. I've had another Ironman (different model) for many years, but needed something black to fit my uniform. After trying a couple G-Shock watches, I couldn't find one that wasn't too big or flashy so I went with what I've used before and still true to it's form, this watch is exactly what I was looking for from the start.
customer_reviews.author: K.R.

customer_reviews.title: I've worn a Timex Ironman watch for years now and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've worn a Timex Ironman watch for years now and this one is the forth one I've purchased. I've had the 30 lap watches in the past and they have held up well. The straps tend to fail before the actual watch does. I do manage to get a few years out of them before this happens. My last one failed after going in and out of the water a number of times. I think the temperature changes caused it to fail. I purchased the ten lap watch to see how it would hold up under the conditions that I put my watches through. I have no complaints about the ironman watches they take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: jerseyshore

customer_reviews.title: I am with watch!
customer_reviews.text: My last iron man watch died and I tried to wait to get another one. I have attention issues, however and really need to be able to check the time constantly. I prefer the men's iron man watches because they are water-resistant, always have at least one predominately black version, keep the day, date, month and time AND they have a light. Also, it's not so big that I feel that it looks unfeminine (I'm a woman). I'm sure it's partly psychological but I feel SO much better to have my new iron man watch!
customer_reviews.author: K. Strand

customer_reviews.title: Watch for regular people
customer_reviews.text: I am wearing this watch right this "second." Easy to operate as long as you don't lose the instructions, but I think they are available online anyway. The alarm is not annoyingly loud. The timer keeps perfect track of how long my wife is allowed to spend in the shoe store (LOL) and cooking. My only grievance about this watch is that is the orange writing so I have to take it off when getting dressed up and I would prefer to wear it even then. If you are a sports nut and need many laps, buy another watch. Most humans do not need 30 or more laps so this is the watch for them.
customer_reviews.author: M. FALINA

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good size. Weather tight. Not a big watch fan but been wearing it daily for well over a year now and still looks and functions well. Indiglo still works and rubber band in good condition. Seems like that the first thing to go sometimes. Made it through a very muddy Spartan race, which means submerged for several minutes and other beatings and poor conditions. Has many features I haven't even gotten to yet. I use the countdown timer for WODs and timer for runs. Never used the alarm. Bought a second one for my son. When it dies, I'll get another.
customer_reviews.author: Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand and its watches. I'm using it for ~3 years and have no complains. I bought 2 more for my friends and they're using it for ~1.5 years daily and there are no complains. Pros: -durable, -waterproof (100m+), -shock-proof (just recently smashed several times very hard with hood - did not get even a scratch) -long-lasting battery (3 years so far vs 1 day 'smart' watch), -look nice -rich variety of sizes and colors If you need to replace the strap, just call to Timex support, they sell it via phone. Tell them model, address, your card number and they will send you a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep in tickin like they used to.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Timex Ironman watches for thirty years and an used to getting over a decade from a watch. I bought one of these for each of my children and expected them to last them until they were out of the house. All three watches had the backlight stop working within a year. I thought this was there battery, which would have been forgivable even though they advertise 10 year batteries, but after replacing batteries the light still doesn't function.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Craig

customer_reviews.title: I like this watch very much except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch very much except for one thing. My problem is that I can not figure out how to consistently re-set the Chrono time. Hitting the stop/reset button works sometimes but not always. I am sure there is a correct sequences of buttons to select for it to work, but, the instructions are not clear on this procedure. Otherwise, I like the size of the buttons and how easy they are to push. The font size is large enough to read. The display is bright. While swimming it is easy to track the number of laps, lap-times and split-times. The data from 10 of these laps can be recall later. Very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Lets go!

customer_reviews.title: Right sized watch with all the necessary features.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a great fit for lean wrists and is easy to read for those of us that need readers. The design of the watch compliments the band and vise versa, fitting the wrist as integrated as a watch can. The band has a nifty invention that holds the surplus band in place after you buckle it on. It's uncomplicated, comfortable, and useful. And if it matters to you, it's actually nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: All plastic parts - but good for the price
customer_reviews.text: 100% plastic and not nearly as substantial as the more expensive Ironman watches (with metal and plastic) I've had over the years. For example, it has a cheap plastic watch face, rather than a thicker glass one. It also has flimsy plastic buttons, instead of metal ones. But, with that said. I use these watches for running/working out and wear them 24/7 then toss them when they stop working. The price is great and they last at least a year or two. You can't buy replacement batteries for much less than the price of this watch. It's a great purchase when you consider the price. It works well, has a very readable display and so-far so-good.
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: Simple operation and easy to use when running
customer_reviews.text: Simple operation and easy to use when running. Had the original Ironman 20 years ago when they first were made and I loved it. Battery went dead after years of use so threw it in my top dresser drawer and forgot about it. Glad to have another.
customer_reviews.author: TK Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: Solid watch but low contrast
customer_reviews.text: Great watch and seems like a quality build. However, the screen is not as bright as I had hoped for. Maybe they didn't design it to be as bright as I would like, or maybe my eyes are not as young as they used to be, although I am only 41. I wear it at the gym to time the time between sets. Since the gym is quite brightly lit, the lighting function is of no used. Bottom line: good quality watch, but the contrast of the numbers to background is too low to be usable for me. It's like trying to read from one of the early versions of the Kindle. Just my opinion though. Hope that helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: 3times3

customer_reviews.title: In every way a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This Timex watch is exactly what I wanted in a wrist watch. The resin case and band are virtually indestructible and easy to clean. The watch size is small enough to be comfortable and large enough to be readable. I can wear it to work, and to errands and social events, and it fits in well for all. Being a Timex means that it always keeps perfect time. In every way a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Fred K

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Has the features I needed, most importantly you can shower with it on. Smart watches don't really like that sort of thing, unless you pay out a LOT of $. Also for those of you who are crafty of a sort, to keep the face of my watch clear, I ordered a cheap 3 pack of smart phone screen protectors, and because the watch screen is generally circular except the bottom fifth, I cut out and installed a screen protector (SP) for my watch, so if the SP ever gets scratched I can take it off, and replace it with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Howard

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought another timex watch since the first one I had worked great out in the field (infantry) and wasn’t so big but oddly enough broke the buckle working on a car. No big deal, did it’s job and willing to get another one but this one was just awful. Lasted me TWO DAYS and someone how water got into it while showering?? I swam in full kit with the other one on and no issues but this one was just a let down. Sucks to see since I’m so comfortable with it
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mena

customer_reviews.title: Great durability and functionality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great durability and functionality for the price. I purchased this one as a replacement for the same one that lasted approximately 10 years of pool swimming, ocean surfing and land running, in addition to daily life. I like that it can keep two different times (for travel in another time zone), its count up chronometer, count down timer, choices of weekday vs daily alarm, and of course the indiglo light. Be advised however, as a friend said, "you have a watch that only tells time?!?" yeah, i don't need to count my steps or check email on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Best watch of it’s type
customer_reviews.text: Second one I have had. Replacing after three or four years. Not too big, but big enough to see readout with no reading glasses. Very subtle look with none of the metal or different colored trim. If you had to wear a plastic watch with a suit, this is the watch you’d pick. This is my daily “go to” watch. Swim in it all the time. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Romano

customer_reviews.title: Great all around watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch! This is my second Timex Ironman watch. The only reason I had to buy another was because I misplaced my first watch after 5 years of daily wear. I really only use the stopwatch feature (other than the clock) but love the design and look of the watch. It's very durable and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S.

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible and also tells the time
customer_reviews.text: So far its held fast from my months of abuse. I never take it off so its been with me everywhere from rock climbing, diving, swimming, running, landscaping, and even in the sauna. My father has the same model but with red buttons. He has had his a little bit longer then me and is still in same condition as when he got it. For me, replacing a timex is more about a style switch up then replacing a broken watch.
customer_reviews.author: MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Iconic Sports Watch
customer_reviews.text: Got this for running and other outdoor activities near water. Love the stopwatch and prefer the buttons to touchscreen smartwatches. Easy to read and can hardly tell when I'm wearing it. Rugged and built for any occasion. Thrilled that Timex is still making this American Iconic timepiece.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Too big for smaller wrists
customer_reviews.text: Too big for my small male wrist. My wrist is 6.25 inches around, and I had to buckle this in the last hole on the strap. The end of the strap was a struggle to insert and remove from the keeper loop, because of a tab they decided to add to the keeper loop. This is getting returned. It's a shame, because this is such a stylish, waterproof watch. Timex needs to offer more "mid-sized" options. I found what I need with the Armitron Sport Unisex 45/7076.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I love the functionality of this watch
customer_reviews.text: I love the functionality of this watch. I've owned three of them in the last three years. They never last more than a year, sometimes less. First one had the strap pin holes break, so the pin holding the strap could not be securely affixed. The last two both had the Indeglo light feature stopped working in less than a year. I only use that feature occasionally at night, maybe twice a week for a second or two. If you buy this Watch you should definitely view it as a disposable or consumable item. They do not last, although I do admit they still keep time after all these other things break.
customer_reviews.author: David In Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Not Water Resistant!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch and have had it about 9 months and wore it everyday and everywhere. Yesterday I took in the ocean with me when I went surfing in Malibu. In the water I checked the time and the Clock was not functioning and none of the buttons were working. Later the watch completely shut itself down and no longer works. I am extremely disappointed and a little upset. This watch claims to be water resistant to a pretty low depth but in my case, the watch didn't hold up at all in little surf no less than a couple feet. This is really strange because I have taken this watch surfing many times.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Jones

customer_reviews.title: Bad copy of a timex
customer_reviews.text: This item was returned due to it not functioning properly. It also looked like a fake copy of a Timex. I’ve been wearing these watches from Timex for sometime. This one does not convince me that it was a legit Timex Ironman watch.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Strong

customer_reviews.title: Dark Display Compared to Earlier Version
customer_reviews.text: My comments are confined to the display. I had a previous version of this watch with a bright display, but it's now darker and unfortunately cannot be read with polarized sunglasses (unless it's perfectly vertical). If this was an LCD screen limitation then I wouldn't complain, but other TIMEX watches (including old version of this model) do not have this limitation and have bright crisp displays nearly unaffected by polarized glasses.. I can only assume it's to save money or related to the specific version of INDIGLO they're using.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: What can I say these watches are built to last. So many people with smart watches but this thing won’t have to be charged every night. Alarm is great. Night light too. Great everyday wear if you like the old fashioned time checker ;)
customer_reviews.author: Phillycheese

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but poor durability
customer_reviews.text: he watch was lightweight and water resistant, so it was great when I was running or swimming. However, the watch strap loop broke after about a year of typical use, and it's disappointing that the product has such poor durability. Second time that this has happened for this watch. I won't be purchasing this again.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 4 Casios in a row but was not happy when they dropped their countdown timer and I had trouble with their "mineral crystal" becoming easily scratched or etched, something that had never happened to my acrylic crystals even when I was much younger and more active. This is the first Timex I've had and it's terrific. It does all I ask and more plus it's lighter and does not catch on my shirt cuff like the Casio. Plus one can adjust the time or alarm, etc. both foreward and backward which makes setting it much easier. If it proves to be as durable as my old Casios I'll be quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Flip Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not my first
customer_reviews.text: This is the fifth Ironman I've had over about 30 years. I have replaced another watch of almost the same design that I know I have had 12 years. I just wore out the band and the battery at the same time. Very pleased with this watch- weighs nearly nothing, can read it without glasses. This is a good watch for running, swimming and life.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: A little big on smaller wrists
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set and use all functions, I got this for my son and it is just a hair big for his small wrist but it is a mens full size watch so that was anticipated. It's held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burn

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, no complaints other my my personal nuances of how I wear watches.
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new ironman watch every 5 or so years. This one has the exact same innards as the one I previously owned, which is nice. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the buttons protrude too much. I accidentally hit the start/stop button on the table all the time, and if I bend my wrist too much it hits the mode and set buttons. That's partly due to the fact I wear my watch facing down, but my previous ironman watches didn't have that problem. I'm not a triathlete, and I don't wear my watch upright, so I'm not their target consumer, but still.
customer_reviews.author: Nick T.

customer_reviews.title: Great men's watch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to replace an older watch from a different manufacturer that had a broken band. So far I really like this watch. It has a slightly smaller face than many men's watches which was something I was looking for. I also really like the simple design of the face. Buttons are easy to push and functions are intuitive. Indiglo lights up the screen very well. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Autry

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great watch for a great price. This is my third Timex Ironman watch and I've loved them all. The bands wear out long before the watches. Multiple timezones, alarms, stopwatch, Indiglo, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Simple watch.. does what it needs to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to use the countdown timer for my workouts. I didn't want to use a cell phone timer, or another timer. I wanted something on my wrist, that counts down, and then has a loud enough alert noise once the countdown is complete. This watch is perfect for exercising.
customer_reviews.author: PSS112

customer_reviews.title: Watch Indiglo feature did not work.
customer_reviews.text: When I press the button to light the Indiglo light, it was very dim and went completely black in under 2 seconds. Pressing the button again did not turn the light on. I would not purchase this item again or purchase from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Warner

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this watch to my husband for Christmas and he really likes it. It keeps time, it fits comfortably, it looks great, the display is easy to read (for those of us over 40); and he has been wearing it everyday. That says a lot since my husband has a large collection of watches. I'm so happy I made the decision to go with Timex. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: only 1 alarm and thicker, solid band
customer_reviews.text: It only has 1 alarm rather than 3 on the previous model. The band is solid rather than open, which means it will not break after 1 year like all my others did, & since the band is not replaceable, I used to have to buy a whole new watch. This band is not as comfortable though. I sweat underneath it since it no longer has an open structure. I liked the previous model of this watch better even though the band broke after a year. It was more comfortable & I miss the extra 2 alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I work in Physical Therapy and need to accurately keep track of a patient's performance during treatment, as well as the time (obviously). The chrono comes in handy for this, and the timer helps as well when it comes to stretches. Beyond the PT clinic, I also wear this a lot at the gym. My gym has a serious lack of clocks (for some odd reason), and this watch is comfortable enough to wear during tough workouts. Plus, it's water resistant, so I don't worry about sweating while wearing it! It's comfortable, functional, and the Indiglo is the perfect brightness for dark conditions. Easy to set and use.
customer_reviews.author: RPoePT

customer_reviews.title: RIP
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on September 8th of 2019. Less than a year old in it is broken because it is not waterproof. It is water resistant. Great looking watch and very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: I love the watch
customer_reviews.text: its looks good and it super comfortable. It is like wearing nothing on your wrist. I run with it on, swim with it, use the stopwatch feature etc and it works perfectly. Very happy that I chose this one
customer_reviews.author: Rick Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a watch for running. I wanted something that would be durable and waterproof. This really fit the bill. It's big enough for me, but small enough for my 13 and 9 year olds. In fact I ended up purchasing a second for the 9 year because he was jealous. They love the indiglo, and I love the fact that they can wear it in the pool, shower, rain, mud, etc. They use the alarm to get themselves up and to make sure I don't have to come looking for them at bedtime. Great investment for a small price
customer_reviews.author: John T Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Good Watch, Bad Band
customer_reviews.text: Other than the side buttons being over-sensitive (they can be easily pushed by just bending your wrist), the watch itself is fine: easy to read, lightweight, not too expensive. The problem is the band. Mine broke after ~8 months of non-strenuous daily use (no damage, no exposure to extreme weather, only got it wet in the shower). Low and behold, the band isn't covered under the Timex warranty, and replacement bands are expensive and only come in black. So my watch is still ticking, but it's now useless less than a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BriGuy

customer_reviews.title: This is the 3rd timexwatch similar to this one I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd timex watch similar to this one I have owned. The others were practically bombproof but earlier models. On this one the big middle start stop button stopped working after 3 weeks and is useless for timing things which I use frequently. I note one other reviewer had this same problem so I think it is likely a common defect. Unfortunately, after 30 days you cannot return the watch, so I have to go through the warranty process with Timex if I want to have them fix it. I guess a great product has been improved and is now junk. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch for use while swimming and outdoor activity. By the second time I wore the watch in the water, it had enough water inside the face that I was not able to see the time. This watch is not at all water resistant. It would have been a great watch if not for that. I am very disappointed. Outside the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Christina S.

customer_reviews.title: Second Ironman watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Ironman watch. After using the new watch for one week, the battery died. Replacing the battery is not easy. Otherwise I love the watch, it's light, easy to use, water tight and (fairly) inexpensive. Expect that the watch band (resin) will break after some time of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY SURE I DIDN'T NEED MORE PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: THE INSTRUCTIONS WEREN'T ACCURATE. FOLLOWING STEP BY STEP, COULDN'T GET WATCH SET AND FUNCTIONING. MAY BE A PROBLEM WITH THE WATCH. PUSH ONE OF THE BUTTONS WHICH IS SUPPOSED TO DO FUNCTION A AND IT DOESN'T DO IT, OR DOES SOMETHING ELSE COMPLETELY. VERY FRUSTRATING.
customer_reviews.author: Littleford

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure if we received 2 lemons in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if we received 2 lemons in the batch, but the first came apart within days. The second lasted a year when the mod button decided to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: A horrible thing. It comes with no instructions at all and no indication of where on line you can find them. I finally tracked down what I think are the right instructions on Timex website but the "mode" button does not seem to operate correctly. I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Picollini

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Watch looks and works fine. It replaces one I had for a long time until the buttons were hard to work and the strap broke. The strap on this one is very stiff, but I assume it will loosen up eventually. It's not uncomfortable, just not form-fitting unless very tight. I got it mostly because of the light so that I can see it when I wake up at night.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Heidenrich

customer_reviews.title: Not so sure now
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch. It has everything I need: lightweight, indiglo, dual time zone, day/week/month display, 100M water resist so I don't have to take it off when swimming or showering. Manufacturers are building their watches of poorer quality as time goes by, either the band breaks within a year or the battery dies. At this price I don't mind just throwing it out and buying another one when either happens. Update [two days later]: I think I spoke too soon. The watch goes into Time 1 and Time 2 mode randomly by itself without any key press. If it gets too annoying, I'll have to send back.
customer_reviews.author: Kachal

customer_reviews.title: hard to read small numbers on dark background
customer_reviews.text: Seemed fine at first glance, not knowing what to expect. But then I also had ordered a different Timex digitaland placing them side-by-side I much preferred the Expedition's display. On this Ironman the background is much darker, therefore the numerics are much harder to read. Was this a lemon or just the way it is? The numbers on the Expedition are also quite a bit bigger, very nice for the old eyes.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Henerey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty junky and chintzy even for a cheap Timex
customer_reviews.text: The watch band is made out of some sort of very stiff plastic. By far the least comfortable watch I have owned. Everything is made from a super cheap looking and cheap feeling plastic except for the metal back. Some Timex Ironman watches I've had in the past were made of "nicer feeling" (for lack of better words) materials. Otherwise it's about like any other entry level Timex Ironman watch you can get for $30 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T. Pribble

customer_reviews.title: great watch
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality Ironman Watch! Regular size, sleek, lightweight, looks great, got the time, stopwatch. I don't run so don't really use the lap timer. I don't use the alarm because I use my phone. It is basically the watch I use everyday. Second one of these I have bought and the other one lasted 3-4 years. You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Mack

customer_reviews.title: Temporary watch
customer_reviews.text: Served me well while overseas trip for a month but dialer would randomly stop functioning until one day it mode button completely died in me. Researched for a bit because of its claimed durability. This was not the case as I have never dropped this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great runners watch for my son running cross country
customer_reviews.text: Great runners watch for my son running cross country. This has all of the needs that a runner needs to monitor their performance except GPS. For his purposes though it tracks what he needs perfectly and looks nice enough without being huge that he can wear it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: John Reviews

customer_reviews.title: This is a good, basic
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, basic watch. It tells time accurately and has decent stopwatch functions. The problem with all these Timex watches is that the bands break and it is difficult to find the right replacement band. I suspect that Timex makes band replacement confusing so that we will just buy another watch instead. Fortunately the watches aren't that expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Watson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but quality is dropping
customer_reviews.text: It worked for what I wanted it for, which was dual time zones. The quality of the product over the past few years has dropped though. It is starting to look cheaply made but it will last for a while. For the most part the button pushing feels funny. But I give it 4 starts for the low price. This version usually costs $30.
customer_reviews.author: Master K

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof only for a few months?
customer_reviews.text: I liked this watch (for most part). I liked that you could set it so that the alarm would go off only on weekdays or on all days. My only gripe was that the lap button was too easy to press and switch between Time zones 1 and 2. However, it took on moisture after 3 months of use in and out of the pool. Now the screen is dead and I have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Rao

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one August, 2016. It's May, 2017, and the little clip that holds the loose band in place broke. This is the second time I bought this watch, and the second time this has happened. Going to go for velcro this time.
customer_reviews.author: rainy

customer_reviews.title: Initially Great
customer_reviews.text: I initally really loved this watch. It looks great and had all the functionality I could ever want. However not even a half year of use and the main center button no longer works at all. This means I can use very few if any of the functions. The watch is still in it's limited warranty, but the cost to fix it is just slightly smaller than the price I paid for a new one (they want something like $8, and I paid around $12). I wish there were better cheap nice looking watches out there. :/
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Put the paper in the trash.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is trash, I purchased it on August 6, and it spotted working September 10th. Ironman more like paperman. That's how long this watch lasted. Save your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Devin Borvansky

customer_reviews.title: Bang For The Buck
customer_reviews.text: I've had many Timex watches just like this one, and they don't disappoint. Bang for the buck, this is a great watch. The red buttons match the red shirt of a Boomer Sooner!!!
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.. but I will still buy another Timex Ironman!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of Timex Ironman watches because they never disappoint! And I loved the watch I got when it first arrived. Shipping was fast, everything was the way it was described and maybe even better! However, a couple of weeks ago, I saw water bubbles in the watch itself. It was still functional, so I ignored it. However, I'm pretty upset For the fact that it stopped working. I really took care of the watch, so I have to say that I was disappointed from what happened. The warranty said that it wouldn't cover for water damage. So although it's still under warranty, it was time for my poor watch...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and durable watch
customer_reviews.text: Price is about 25-30 bucks lower here on amazon then a regular store. Excellent value and durable watch. Other reviewers say the buttons are too sensitive. I do not agree with that assessment. I have found that if you ratchet this watch down on your wrist super tight then it is possible for your wrist movements to trip the buttons, however most of us wear it normal not that tight and the buttons never get tripped.
customer_reviews.author: Tamjawn

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this model of watch before. And I left it on when I was in the swimming pool, and it died. Hard to believe that a watch named after an event that involves swimming could fail so quickly and so catastophically. Never again, for this watch in particular and Timex in general.
customer_reviews.author: billyboyles

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch except for 1 annoying feature
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch except for the placement of the start/split button - it's the black button on the bottom of the watch face. The way I hold and cross my arms I seem to accidentally push that button, which changes the shown time from T1 to T2 and back. Without knowing I've accidentally pushed the button the watch may be showing another time zone's time so I may think it's a different time than it really is - very annoying. After putting up with this for several months I've decided I can't put up with it any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ray

customer_reviews.title: Paid $16 for it in January 2016 and it was wonderful. HOWEVER
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I was THRILLED with this watch. Paid $16 for it in January 2016 and it was wonderful. HOWEVER, as of July 2016, it is no longer "water proof" I've only worn it in the shower and all of a sudden there is condensation in the window and the buttons no longer work without error. It no longer keeps accurate time. Plus, as mentioned by another reviewer, the purchase price has since gone up. I'll be looking for another option. :(
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Simple gets it done
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. Got the same one for so long I lost track. It's easy to use and has everything I need; stopwatch with a lap function, timer, alarm and a light. It's all black so it goes with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: and I do truly like the simplicity of this watch
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Timex watches for a while, and I do truly like the simplicity of this watch. Options for two different clocks (for those who travel a lot), a beep option, and recall features make this watch a great watch to wear. I normally break out in a rash from the back side of watches on my wrist from wearing them too much, but I haven't had that issue with this watch.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: My old friend
customer_reviews.text: This is about the fifth of these minimalist Ironmans I've had. Obviously they are good or I wouldn't keep coming back. I put it on and don't take it off until the battery dies. After about 3 years the face is scared and the strap is beginning to crack so when the battery dies this time I retire it and get another. At about $25 for 3 years use it's cheap, totally accurate and has the functions I need for jogging and every-day watch stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Jones

customer_reviews.title: User Guide is extremely fine print and difficult to read
customer_reviews.text: I liked the format relative keeping the time and the format of the day of week, month and the day. when seting up the watch I found the directions somewhat confusing and difficult to follow. If you have difficulty reading fine print I suggest you download the user gouide directly from Timex.com
customer_reviews.author: Bio Joe

customer_reviews.title: Watch Review
customer_reviews.text: The only negative things I can say about this watch is the size of the small display and I don't think the band is replaceable .
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C. Wieber

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Buttons
customer_reviews.text: The buttons will react to the slightest push. That is the only thing that I had a problem with. I would definitely not recommend this watch but I would recommend their higher end watches which I have had great luck with.
customer_reviews.author: Troop Gug

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: This watch holds up! I wear it while working out, showering, while at work where I often have to fit my hand into tight spaces and it never disappoints. Good watch for a person who has a physical labor job and also for someone who wants something easy to operate and comfortable while at the gym or running.
customer_reviews.author: a2cool

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Very simplecwatch. I gave fivecstars for water resistance but do not swim it is good for work
customer_reviews.author: WTF2016

customer_reviews.title: Timex Ironman classic
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a classic. Face is not large, is actually slim. Does not interfere with wrist movements. Buttons easy to push.
customer_reviews.author: Sinatrablu

customer_reviews.title: and it is so close to perfect. My only issue
customer_reviews.text: I adore this watch, and it is so close to perfect. My only issue: the face scratches so easily. It will end up getting scratched just from daily wear. I would think a sports watch might be scratch resistant or something, but otherwise this watch is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Walski

customer_reviews.title: It's keeps on running!
customer_reviews.text: These watches are a staple of mine. I've owned about 4 of them in my lifetime. They are just simply reliable, accurate, worry free, waterproof (we have a pool and like the ocean) so no need to fuss about removing them. Eventually they need a new battery or a band will break after years of use and abuse but they are so cost effective, I always just buy a new one instead of trying to replace a part or battery. All in all a great group of watches.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R. Rue

customer_reviews.title: Everything a sporty guy wants
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this watch in the past for my husband, but I wanted to try other brands only to be very disappointed. This watch has everything my husband wants: waterproof, alarms, laps, sleek design, sporty, indiglo. He's happy that I bought this one again. I guess if it's good, keep on buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mel

customer_reviews.title: This watch functions as it's designed to function. However ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch functions as it's designed to function. However, its face display is too small to read underwater with goggles on. Now, that some time has lapsed since purchasing this product. I wear this watch each time I swim laps and have become accustom to its face and alarm volume. Therefore, I am increasing my rating of this product from 3 stars to four stars to show my increased satisfaction with its design and function.
customer_reviews.author: Wendellt2

customer_reviews.title: Great Time piece.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Every function and feature I Wanted at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Quack

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing a Timex of some model for 40+ years. This model is not as big and bulky as my original Ironman. It also does not have all those features that I do not need or remember how to use. Nice size, day,month, date,time,push button light, that is all I need. It has a lap feature that I don't use but probably comes in handy for some folks.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose watch for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of these and use it when I swim to time my laps. It does everything for me that I need. Has two time zones, a countdown timer, a stop watch, an alarm and also a night light to see the time in the dark. This watch does it all, is durable and lightweight and at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: M.Medina

customer_reviews.title: kind of annoying
customer_reviews.text: I only buy ironmans as they are cheap and tough but this particular one is super annoying as i'm always changing the timezone unintentionally. Maybe the button is too big idk but i've never had this problem before
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: You can figure out how to work the watch without an instruction manual.
customer_reviews.text: You can take laps and actually retrieve them. I had bought a Dakota watch that claimed it had this feature, but in fact you could not recall the laps. The button that was supposed to do that just cleared the memory. But the Timex works as advertised. The instruction manual is indecipherable due to tiny print. Attempts to find the information online failed.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Had previous version of this watch which lasted for several years. I only bought a new one because the bad finally broke. Bought this one in April. Already needs replacing as the light and and Stop / Start button don't work.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence j. riley

customer_reviews.title: Love This Watch
customer_reviews.text: I got in the habit of using my cell phone for my clock/watch, but I needed something more convenient for new responsibilities at work. I wear this everyday, use it throughout the day at work, and have gotten back into the habit of looking at my wrist for the time/date rather than pulling out my cell phone to check it. I've had several Ironman watches through the years, love them all. Like this large size and large display--easy to read, easy to push the buttons, and fashionable for male or female.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: SUper watch. Large characters, easy to use, good price, keeps excellent time.
customer_reviews.author: Ekaterina Puffini

customer_reviews.title: Agree not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Agree with other reviews, not water resistant. Two months after purchase, first time swimming (not diving, not aggressively diving in, just swimming) and now with fog and condensation/moisture. Trying a different model, but this is clearly below other Timex standards, I have had maybe five or six others over the years which did great.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Sedgwick

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago. It faded in color within 6 months. The rubber/resin strap holder broke off a few months ago as well. Still tried to wear it, but 2 days ago the watch basically dry-rotted and snapped in half. All I do is normal wear. I rarely take on and off. Does not appear to be durable. Had my last Timex watch for 3-4 years before this happened. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mdub2345

customer_reviews.title: Good watch
customer_reviews.text: My Army husband loves this watch, does everything he needs it to.
customer_reviews.author: M. Georgeson

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for timed workouts, running, HIIT, Crossfit, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch to use for timing Crossfit/HIIT workouts. It's very lightweight, waterproof, and easy to use. I use it for both task priority (timed) and time priority (countdown) workouts and it works great for that. Also looks good enough to wear with street cloths. Great all around watch - I highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: SanL

customer_reviews.title: Timex failed to deliver a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Display background was dark gray not light gray as shown in sales picture. Very hard to read time. Replacement watch had the same problem. Return both. I have owned timex watches for over 40 years, never seen this type of problem before.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This watch is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This watch is perfect for me. I gave my Rolex to my son so I could wear this much, much, more functional watch. I dive to 60ft. + with it, use the alarm clock, time my swimming with the chronograph, stay aware the day, date and time. Im no longer impressed with glitz and advertising. I want something that really works for me. This watch is the ticket!
customer_reviews.author: freediver

customer_reviews.title: This BASIC feels cheaper but performs fine. I will fork out another $10 or so ...
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing Timex Ironman since 80's. This watch performs on par as all other IM's. This BASIC feels cheaper but performs fine. I will fork out another $10 or so next time for the better look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: w

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my nephew who's 23 and he loves it. It's now his new work watch. He works on cars and this watch is very durable if he bangs into cars , tires and such. That was the main reason I got it because the watch he had was metal and kept getting damaged. So far this watch is still in awesome shape!!
customer_reviews.author: debbi gibbs

customer_reviews.title: I love thiswatch and have had three or four over ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch and have had three or four over the last 20 years. It is great to use if you run and very easy to use. I eventually replace them when the battery dies or in this case when I lose it. Have continued to buy this exact watch for over 20 years. They have made it a little less bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lins

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this watch
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this watch. Easy to use and accurate. only downfall is the it doesn't sit perfectly in the middle of my wrist. The buckle does but the watch is over to the ide.
customer_reviews.author: Ackster

customer_reviews.title: Fair Value what else do you want?
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of the watch. It's easy to set up and fills all of my needs. I gave it 4 stars only because the resin band is cheap and they should use a rubber band. If that is too costly, Timex should offer a choice to upgrade the band. Also, the watchbands should be offered in other colors. I believe it is a good dollar value. It keeps ticking and I wear it 24 hrs. a day.
customer_reviews.author: Buddelp1

product_meta.title: Timex Full-Size Ironman Essential 10 Watch
product_meta.description:
The best part about this sporty watch is you’ll almost forget you’re wearing it. Pool, beach and shower-resistant, lightweight and perfect for staying active.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :7.99 x 1.65 x 0.47 inches; 1.44 Ounces
 * Item model number :TW5M11400
 * Department :Mens
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :March 17, 2017
 * Manufacturer :Timex Corporation
 * ASIN :B01N2U5HNJ

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #50,400 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #201 inMen's Wrist Watches 
    *  #12717 inMen's Shops 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.3 out of 5 stars1,242 ratings The best part about this sporty watch is you’ll almost forget you’re wearing it. Pool, beach and shower-resistant, lightweight and perfect for staying active.
feature_bullets: Durable Resin Strap with Buckle Closure
Water resistant to 100m (330ft): in general, suitable for swimming and snorkeling, but not diving
